body:
### Problem

`q` mapping in man pages is not consistent, as in file `runtime/ftplugin/man.vim`:

<https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/cd8e15e3373dc9544d582640f043d3dee83a953d/runtime/ftplugin/man.vim#L29-L33>

When opening man file not from command line (e.g., `man ls`), `get(g:, 'pager')` is always `0`. Therefore, the following ways of quitting with q when man page is the only window will fail with E444:

1. `nvim --clean man://ls`
2. `nvim --clean -c 'Man ls' -c 'wincmd p' -c 'wincmd q' -c 'normal q'`
3. `export MANPAGER='nvim -c "Man!" -'; man ls # quit ; nvim -c 'execute "normal \<C-o>"' -c 'normal q'`

### Current work around/fix

- remove `:lclose<CR><C-W>c` mapping in `runtime/ftplugin/man.vim`

```diff
--- a/runtime/ftplugin/man.vim
+++ b/runtime/ftplugin/man.vim
@@ -26,11 +26,7 @@ if !exists('g:no_plugin_maps') && !exists('g:no_man_maps')
   nnoremap <silent> <buffer> k             gk
   nnoremap <silent> <buffer> gO            :lua require'man'.show_toc()<CR>
   nnoremap <silent> <buffer> <2-LeftMouse> :Man<CR>
-  if get(g:, 'pager')
-    nnoremap <silent> <buffer> <nowait> q :lclose<CR><C-W>q
-  else
-    nnoremap <silent> <buffer> <nowait> q :lclose<CR><C-W>c
-  endif
+  nnoremap <silent> <buffer> <nowait> q :lclose<CR><C-W>q
 endif

 if get(g:, 'ft_man_folding_enable', 0)
```

- or, setup custom autocmd for manpage:

```lua
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("FileType", {
  pattern = "man",
  group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup("UserConfigs", { clear = true }),
  callback = function(evt)
    map("n", "d", "<C-d>", { buffer = evt.buf, desc = "PageDown(man)" })
    map("n", "u", "<C-u>", { buffer = evt.buf, desc = "PageUp(man)" })
    -- overwrite q-mapping in runtime/ftplugin/man.vim
    map("n", "q", ":lclose<CR><C-W>q", { buffer = evt.buf, desc = "Quit(man)" })
  end,
})
```

Related Issue/PR: #20625, #28495

### Steps to reproduce

1. `nvim --clean man://ls`
2. `nvim --clean -c 'Man ls' -c 'wincmd p' -c 'wincmd q' -c 'normal q'`

3.1 `export MANPAGER='nvim -c "Man!" -'; man ls # quit then run`
3.2 `nvim -c 'execute "normal \<C-o>"' -c 'normal q'`


### Expected behavior

Successfully quit the window.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.11.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not sure

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04

### Terminal name/version

Windows Terminal

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

Appimage

comment_data.body:
> When opening man file not from command line (e.g., `man ls`), `get(g:, 'pager')` is always `0`. Therefore, the following ways of quitting with q when man page is the only window will fail with E444

This is intentional. 

However, it's been such a source of bug reports that I think it's not worth the trouble. 

- simpler to document if it always behaves the same
- simpler implementation
- `<C-W>q` will confirm before losing any unsaved work

So, PR welcome. Should be mentioned in `:help news-changed`.

title: Man: E444 when quitting man page with q
